ul.li: To execute an XQuery refactoring operation using this script, in additional to the scripting commercial license, you are required to purchase a Saxon EE license.

body.p: The XML Refactoring script (xmlRefactoring.sh, found in the scripts subfolder inside Oxygen's installation directory) can be used to execute XML refactoring operations. You can run a refactoring operation by specifying the operation id of the operation. If, in addition to the refactoring operations provided by in the OXYGEN_INSTALL_DIR/refactoring folder and in framework configurations, you want to run a custom refactoring operation, you have to specify the directory that contains it, using the od (operations directory) argument.

section.title: Arguments for the XML Refactoring Script

p.codeblock: sh scripts/xmlRefactoring.sh -id operationId -i inputFilesOrDirectories [-f filesFilter] [-od operationsDirectory] [-p param1=value1...] [-v]

dlentry.dd: The ID of the refactoring operation to be executed.
A list of space-separated input files or directories that the refactoring operation is applied to.
Specifies a filter for the input files by using a file pattern. For example, to restrict the operation to only analyze build files, you could use build*.xml for the file pattern.

dd.p: A directory that contains additional refactoring operations.

dlentry.dd: A list of space-separated pairs of a parameter's name and value used by the refactoring operation.
This argument can be specified to activate verbose logging.
